subclassFeature.name: College of Lofi Beats to Study/Relax To
entries: Many bards pride themselves on peppy music that inspires dancing and singing along. Bards of the College of Lofi Beats to Relax/Study To recognize that sometimes, you need to calm it down. When one of these bards is around, you know that we're just vibin' here.

subclassFeature.name: Good Vibes Only
entries: Your beats are chill, and it helps your allies focus and stay in the moment. When you are performing, anyone who is copying a spell into their spellbook can do so twice as fast as they normally can, as you're heling them study/relax.

In addition, your very presence brings a calming atmosphere. All allies within 30 feet of you, including yourself, have advantage on Constitution checks to maintain concentration on a spell they are casting.

subclassFeature.name: Hey, can you just chill?
entries: At 6th level, your enemies also begin to feel the pure chill. You can use your music to calm someone who's just going too hard. When an enemy uses their reaction, you, using your reaction, can force them to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a fail, your beats nullify their reaction and prevent it from making any reactions (including this one) due to its relaxed state of mind. It repeats this saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

If the enemy fails this saving throw by 5 or more, they must make another Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. If they fail again, they fall asleep, as if effected by {@spell sleep} spell, provided they can fall asleep.

subclassFeature.name: Slowed + Reverb
entries: At 14th level, you've become the embodiment of relaxation. Whenever you hear a song performed, you are able to perfectly replicate it, but only as slowed down version and with heavy magical reverb.

In addition, as an action, you can perform a song that is just so relaxing that your enemies have to give in to the chill. All enemies within 60 feet that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC. On a fail, for the next minute, they can no longer add their ability score modifier to any attack they make.
